category.name: wcf.acp.option
category.item: Number of notifications which are processed during each Bot run (comments, conversations).
Number of members who are processed during each Bot run (group assignment, inactivity).
Defines after which period of time old entries are to be deleted.

category.name: wcf.acp.uzbot
category.item:
“Affected User(s)” can, in many cases, be defined as receiver of a notification. By standard, the affected user is a user being passively affected by an action, e.g. group assignment.


Some Bots, however, monitor the acting users, too. One example is the reporting Bot. To be able to also address the reporting user (= acting user) he can be defined as “Affected User(s)”. Using 2 Bots, it is possible to send notifications to the reporting and the reported user on the same report.
Insert the start value and the intervall. Both values may be negative.
The time is in the past.
At least on comment type must be selected.
Only comments will be deleted which don’t have a user anymore. Any user conditions below will be disregarded.

Usually one notification is created for each action. If, for example, 15 users are affected by an action “User - Group Assignment”, 15 notification will be send to individually notify each user.

Using “Condense Results” you can summarize all action results in a single notification. For that, you have to enter a combination of placeholder and text into the text field “Summary” below, in which each result is stored. The result will then be entered into the notification’s text as a list or comma-separated text.

Use either the placeholder [condense-list] or [condense-comma] to achieve that. One example for an action “User - Group Assignment”:


[user-name] ([user-age]) was added to the group "[usergroup]" and the placeholder [condense-comma] will result in:

admin (35) was added to the group "Testgruppe", testuser (46) was added to the group "Testgruppe", Beipielnutzer (22) was added to the group "Testgruppe"


Notice: The placeholder [condense-list] may only be used once and must not be in a line with other text in die editor window for a correct display within the notification. Please make sure it gets an own line. Beiing in its own line, it may be formatted individually by editor means.
only users will be considered, whose state was changed by the bot.

In addition to the Bot-specific conditions, you may add further general conditions as found at many places in WoltLab Community Suite.


Users, who should be affected by the action, must fulfil these and eventually already configured Bot-specific conditions. If no conditions are specified, all users will be affected by the action.

Community Bot remembers which user actions already were executed. These actions, like reminding, disabling or bans, may serve as condition for other Bot actions.


Configure Bot-specific conditions the select certain users for an action. If no conditions are specified, all users will be affected by the action.
Do you really want to copy the Bot?
Do you really want to delete the Bot?
Feed has no title and/or no description
Feed has no ID and/or no description
Feed item has no title and/or no description
Feed item has no ID, no link and/or no title
Downloads a backup of the inactivities to your local machine.
Only entries are imported, which don’t contain any of the entered search words. Separate multiple search words with a comma.
Only entries are imported, which contain at least one of the entered search words. Separate multiple search words with a comma.
Only entries are imported, which are not older than the entered number of days. Enter “0” to import all entries.
Only the entered number of entries is imported. Enter “0” to import all entries.
Do you really want to reset the feedreader?
Use categories of feed item as tags
Optional description of the Bot. A maximum of 255 characters is allowed.
Short title for display in the ACP. A maximum of 80 characters is allowed.
Category to which the Bot is assigned to.
No category found. Please add a category first.
The bot cannot be deleted because it is needed for notifications. However, it can be deleted after deactivation.

During test mode, Bot actions are not executed. It is tested how many users / object will be affected by the Bot action. The results, to include notifications (limited to one affected user), are shown in the Bot log.
In test mode, Bot and logging must be activated.
You have to select at least one group.
An unknown error occurred during upload.
Maximum number of reminders a user may get.
Do you really want to clear the log?
User group for group assignment is invalid.
User group for group assignment is invalid.
Articles are disabled by the module configuration.
Comments are disabled by the module configuration.
Conversations are disabled by the module configuration.
The author / sender may not be invisible participant.
“Leave” removes the author from the conversation, but the conversation is still visible in the folder Conversations. “Leave completely” additionally removes the conversation from the folder.

“Individual conversation” will create an own conversation for each receiver. When using “Group conversation” all receivers will be summerized in one single conversation. Attention: Only a maximum of 91 visible participants per conversation is possible.
Comma-separated list of email address for a visible copy.
You inserted an invalid email address.
Comma-separated list of email address for an invisible copy.
You inserted an invalid email address.
Complete server file path to attachment. Leave empty to not send an attachment.
The attachment either does not exist or is not readable.

Please choose how Community Bot should handle the language for this notification.


“Automatic” will automatically adjust the language to match the receiver(s) of the notification resp. adjusts it to the default language when dealing with entries like post, thread or Blog.


“All Languages” will send notifications in all available languages at the same time. Articles will be created multilingual.


Selecting a specific language will result in one notification in exactly this language. However, in multilingual communities you have to enter the texts in all available languages.
Affected users cannot be notified with this bot by this notification.
If no group assignment is selected you have to configure a notification.

There are 3 different kinds of receivers, which may freely be combined most of the time and from which at least one has to be selected.


Choosing “Affected User(s)” will send notifications only to users, who are directly affected by an action. This is the correct configuration in most cases.

“Single Receiver(s)” may be used to address certain users. Insert their username separated by comma.

Selecting “Receiver Group(s)” allows you to send notification to all users of one or more user groups.


For emails, additional CC- and BCC-addresses may be inserted.


If desired, you may filter receivers by their status and/or language. Thereby it can be, for example, avoided to notify banned users.
Only users, who fulfill the following conditions, will receive a notification.
At least one invalid receiver group was selected.
At least one receiver must be configured.
The username {$name} could not be found.
Username of the author / sender of the notification. Note: On emails, only the username of the sender is used; the used email address equals the sender address as configured in the ACP.
Actions, which the Bot is to execute.
Only the notification must be configured.
Only the notification must be configured. You can, however, monitor only certain users by configuring “General User Conditions”.
Only the notification must be configured. You can, however, choose, whether the reported user (default) or the reporting user (= acting user) is treated as “Affected User”.
Only the notification must be configured. You can, however, choose, whether the warned user (default) or the warning user (= acting user) is treated as “Affected User”.
The bot may not be changed yet because notifications are still being processed.
You must insert at least one number.
An invalid user group was selected.
You must select at least one item.
One or more numbers separated by comma.
You always have to select a Bot action.

This Bot retrieves data from RSS- and Atom-feeds and sends notifications containing the these data. If required, the time of the notification can be adapted to that of the feed news; however, personal notifications are excluded.

If only feed news should be retrieved, which contain certain words, use “Positive Filter”. “Negative Filter” allows for selecting news, which do not contain certain words.


The Bot remembers which news were retrieved and prevents them from being retrieved again. To override this and to retrieve those news again, just click “RESET” below.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[feed-description]Description of the feed
[feed-link]URL of the feed
[feed-title]Name of the feeds
[feeditem-categories]Categories of the feed news
[feeditem-content]Content of the feed news
[feeditem-description]Description of the feed news
[feeditem-link]URL of the feed news
[feeditem-systemdate]Date of the feed news
[feeditem-systemtime]Time of the feed news
[feeditem-time]Time of the feed news in its format
[feeditem-title]Title of the feed news

The following general placeholders are available:

[count]Number of retrieved news (always 1)
[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

This Bot checks whether updates for installed packages are available.

Only the notification must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[updates]List of package names

The following general placeholders are available:

[count]Number of found updates
[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

This Bot checks whether errors occured in the WSC. It check the error log for new entries.

Only the notification must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of errors (0 or 1)
[errors]Found errors in short form (ID, date, message, file) since last check
[errors-full]Found errors complete and formatted
[errors-unformatted]Found errors complete and unformatted

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

This Bot deletes conversations which fulfill the following conditions. Configuring Bot-specific and / or General user conditions will restrict deletion to conversations created by these users. The number of conversations per Bot run can be configured (default: 300).

Optionally, you can configure notifications to get feedback about the number of deleted conversations or to inform users about the deletion of conversations.

The participants of the conversations are the affected users and can be directly addressed.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of deleted conversations
[user-count]Number of deleted conversations the respective user participated in

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the reporting of users and/or contents and sends respective notifications.

By selecting the Affected User the notification can be sent to either the reporting or the reported user. Using two Bots both users can be addressed, even with different notifications.


Notice: Since guests may report contents/users resp. contents without users as owner may be reported, it might not always be possible to translate all user-specific placeholders.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of reports (always 1)
[object-link]Link to reported content
[object-text]Text of content
[object-title]Title of content
[object-userid]ID of user who created the content
[object-userlink]Link to profile of user
[object-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[object-username]Name of user
[report-userid]ID of reporting user (or 0)
[report-userlink]Link to profile of user (or Guest)
[report-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user (or Guest)
[report-username]Name of user (or Guest)
[report-text]Text or report

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot allows sending notification to all or selected user in form of a circular.

Users can be selected by Bot-specific and General Conditions. They are considered as affected users and will individually be notified if a respective notification is selected (email, comment, conversation).

When using notifications without receiver (e.g. article, thread or post) only one notification will be sent independent on the number of affected users.


Notice: Since guests may report contents/users resp. contents without users as owner may be reported, it might not always be possible to translate all user-specific placeholders. User-specific placeholders can’t be used.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of affected users.
[counter]Freely configurable counter which is increased or decreased after each successful Bot-run.
[counter+1]A.m. counter + 1.
[counter-1]A.m. counter - 1.

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot deletes comments which fulfill the following conditions. Configuring Bot-specific and / or General user conditions will restrict deletion to comments created by these users. The number of comments per Bot run can be configured (default: 300).

Optionally, you can configure a notification to get feedback about the number of deleted comments or to inform users about the deletion of comments.

The authors of the comments are the affected users and can be directly addressed.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of deleted comments
[user-count]Number of deleted comments the respective user hast created or has replied to

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot creates a daily statistics with system data like articles, users, comments.

Only the notification must be configured. And there are no affected users.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[stats]Formatted statistics data
[date-from]Date of the period’s beginning
[time-from]Time of period’s beginning
[date-to]Date of the period’s end
[time-to]Time of period’s end

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

--

This Bot adds user to a user group or removes them from a group. The number of users per Bot run can be configured (default: 300).

User an be selected by Bot-specific or general conditions. They can be, but must not, be informed about the group change by a selectable notification. The bot allows for summarizing the results in a single notification; see help below.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[usergroup]Name of the user group

The following general placeholders are available:

[count]Number of affected users
[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the registration of new user resp. the creation of users in the ACP.

New users are affected users und can be assigned to a selectable user group and / or a notification about resp. for the new user can be sent. Either the group assignment or the notification (or both in parallel) must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of user including the new user
[usergroup]Name of the user group

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the registration of new user resp. the creation of users in the ACP to send a notification if a predefined number of users is reached.

You can insert one or more comma-separated values upon which the notification is sent. E.g. 100,250,500,1000.

The new user is the affected user and can be directly addressed.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of users including the new user

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the birthdays of the users and sends notifications if birthdays are found. The user’s privacy settings are respected; only users are accounted for who have made their birthday public in the profile.

Depending on the settings for birthday user custom fields, no birthdays may be found. This can be overruled by selecting “Force Birthsdays”.

The birthday users are the affected users and can be directly addressed.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of users having birthday

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the user’s membership period to send a notification if a predefined number of years is reached.

You can insert one or more comma-separated year values upon which the notification is sent. E.g. 1,2,5,10.

The anniversary users are the affected users and can be directly addressed.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of users with membership anniversary
[user-count]User’s membership period in years

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the inactivity of the users and can, based on various conditions, execute numerous actions and send notification in resprect to inactivities. The number of users per Bot run can be configured (default: 300).


By combining multiple Bots complex reactions on user’s inactivities are possible. E.g. users can, in chronological order, be reminded first (even multiple times) and then be disabled, banned and at last even be deleted. In combination with the Bot “User - Group assignment” even more options are available.

The inactive users are the affected users and can be directly addressed. Members of the Admin Group are automatically excluded from the actions disable, ban and delete.

If disabled users are enabled by the admin or a Bot, all existing reminders are deleted. The user starts again with 0 in regard to the inactivity. The same is true for the unbanning of users.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. Except for deletion, this also applies to notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too. If you wish only one notification, you have to activate “Condense Results”.
When deleting users, user-specific placeholders and additional receivers are not available and the user-releated notifications (comment, conversation, system) are not possible.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of inactive users (per Bot run)
[deleted]Information about all deleted users (ID, name, eMail)
[deleted-usernames]Names of deleted users
[user-count]Duration of inactivity of affected user in days

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the warning of users and sends respective notifications.

By selecting the Affected User the notification can be sent to either the warned user (default) or the warning user. Using two Bots both users can be addressed, even with different notifications.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of warnings (always 1)
[object-link]Link to warned content / profil
[object-text]Text of content / profile
[object-title]Title of content / profile
[object-userid]ID of user who created the warned content / profile
[object-userlink]Link to profile of user
[object-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[object-username]Name of user
[warning-expires]Expiration of warning in format “date, time” or “never”
[warning-points]Points of warning
[warning-reason]Reason for warning
[warning-title]Title of warning
[warning-userid]ID of warning user
[warning-userlink]Link to profile of user
[warning-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[warning-username]Name user

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors user accounts and settings and sends notifications if the user changes something.

You can select more than one monitoring item. It will, as far as possible, be explained what the user has changed; e.g. the new text of a signature.

The user, who changed his settings, is the affected user and can be directly addressed.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of changes (always 1)
[user-setting]Made changes (e.g. “avatar”, “cancellation of user account”, “other settings”)

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors user group assignments and sends notifications if the user was added to and/or removed from a group.

Group changes during user bulk processing or by other plugins are not monitored.

The determined users are the affected users and can be directly addressed.


Notice: one notification will be created for each affected user. This is valid for notifications without individual receiver, like article, threads and posts, too.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of changes (always 1)
[group-add]Groups the user was added to
[group-change]Made group changes. Example: assigned to user group(s): xyz | removed from user group(s): 123
[group-remove]Groups the user was removed from

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the distribution of reactions and sends notifications when users receive reactions.

The affected user is always the user receiving the reaction.


“Total number of reactions” will force a notification when the total number of reactions reaches one of the values in “Trigger Values”.

Using “Xth reaction of a user” the notification will be sent when the affected user’s count for reactions reaches one of the values in “Trigger Values”.

“User with the most reactions” will force a notification when the user with the most reactions changes. Trigger values don’t need to be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of reactions
[count-user]Number of reactions of the affected user
[reaction]Icon of reaction
[object-link]Link to the object (e.g. comment, post, image) for which the reaction was given.
[object-text]Text of the object
[object-title]Title of the object
[object-userid]ID of the owner of the object
[object-userlink]Link to the owner’s profile
[object-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[object-username]Name of the owner
[liker-id]ID of the user who gave the reaction.
[liker-link]Link to the user’s profile
[liker-link2]Masked link to the user’s profile
[liker-name]Name of the user

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the update / deletion of articles (CMS) and creates a notification when a user updates or deletes an article. The monitoring may be restricted to a category as needed.

The affected user is always the user who created the article.

On multilingual articles, one notification will be sent for each article language.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of articles
[count-published]Total number of published articles
[count-user]Number of edited articles (always 1)
[object-action]Executed action (updated or deleted)
[object-category]Categorie of the article
[object-image-tiny]Tiny image of the article
[object-image-small]Small image of the article
[object-image-medium]Medium image of the article
[object-image-large]Large image of the article
[object-teaserimage-tiny]Tiny teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-small]Small teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-medium]Medium teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-large]Large teaser image of the article
[object-link]Link to the article or deletion notice
[object-status]Status of the article (published / unpublished) or deletion notice
[object-teaser]Teaser of the article
[object-text]Text of the article
[object-title]Title of the article
[editor-id]ID of the editor
[editor-link]Link to the editor’s profile
[editor-link2]Masked link to the editor’s profile
[editor-name]Name of the editor

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the creation of articles (CMS) and sends a notification when a user creates an article. The monitoring may be restricted to a category and / or published articles as needed.

The affected user is always the user who created the article.

On multilingual articles, one notification will be sent for each article language.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of articles
[count-published]Total number of published articles
[count-user]Number of edited articles (always 1)
[object-category]Categorie of the article
[object-image-tiny]Tiny image of the article
[object-image-small]Small image of the article
[object-image-medium]Medium image of the article
[object-image-large]Large image of the article
[object-teaserimage-tiny]Tiny teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-small]Small teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-medium]Medium teaser image of the article
[object-teaserimage-large]Large teaser image of the article
[object-link]Link to the article or deletion notice
[object-status]Status of the article (published / unpublished) or deletion notice
[object-teaser]Teaser of the article
[object-text]Text of the article
[object-title]Title of the article

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the receipt of trophies by users.

The affected user is always the user who received the trophy.

Under “Trigger Values”, trophies can be defined by their ID to be monitored. Leave field blank to react on all trophies.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Total number of given trophies
[trophy-id]ID of the trophy
[trophy-link]Link to the trophy
[trophy-name]Name of the trophy

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the sending of the contact form by members and guests.

The affected user is always the receiver selected in the contact form.

Only the notification must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of sent forms (always 1)
[contact-email]Email address of the sender
[contact-guest]Guest status of sender (yes = guest, no = member)
[contact-name]Name of the sender
[contact-text]Formatted form text
[contact-username]Username of the sender (or guest)
[contact-userlink]Link to the sender (or guest)

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the banning of users and sends respective notifications.

The affected user is always the user who was banned.

Only the notification must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of bans
[ban-expire]End of ban period (empty or date in format YYYY-MM-DD)
[ban-reason]Reason for ban
[ban-userid]ID of user who banned
[ban-userlink]Link to profile of user
[ban-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[ban-username]Username of the user (or guest)

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

This Bot monitors the unbanning of users and sends respective notifications. An automatic unbanning can not be detected in all cases.

The affected user is always the user who was unbanned.

Only the notification must be configured.


The following Bot-specific placeholders are available:

[count]Number of unbans
[ban-userid]ID of user who unbanned
[ban-userlink]Link to profile of user
[ban-userlink2]Masked link to profile of user
[ban-username]Username of the user (or guest)

The following general placeholders are available:

[date]Date of Bot execution
[time]Time of Bot execution
[page]Name of this website, as defined in ACP
[receiver]Username of the receiver of a notification

The following user-specific placeholders are available:

[user-age]Age of the user
[user-email]Email address of the user
[user-groups]Names of the user groups the user is member of
[user-id]ID of the user
[user-name]Name of the user
[user-profile]Link to the user’s profile
[@user-profile]Link to the user’s profile with notification (posts only)

category.name: wcf.user.condition
category.item: You cannot simultaneously select “Reminded” and “Not reminded”.

category.name: wcf.uzbot
category.item: deletion of the user account cancelled
user account deleted: deadline set to {@$value|time}

Members
- Total: {#$userTotalOld} -- {#$userTotal} ({if $userTotal > $userTotalOld}+{/if}{$userTotal - $userTotalOld})
- Banned: {#$userBannedOld} -- {#$userBanned} ({if $userBanned > $userBannedOld}+{/if}{$userBanned - $userBannedOld})
- Disabled: {#$userDisabledOld} -- {#$userDisabled} ({if $userDisabled > $userDisabledOld}+{/if}{$userDisabled - $userDisabledOld})
- Deletion: {#$userDeletedOld} -- {#$userDeleted} ({if $userDeleted > $userDeletedOld}+{/if}{$userDeleted - $userDeletedOld})

Follower
- Total: {#$followerOld} -- {#$follower} ({if $follower > $followerOld}+{/if}{$follower - $followerOld})

Article
- Total: {#$articleTotalOld} -- {#$articleTotal} ({if $articleTotal > $articleTotalOld}+{/if}{$articleTotal - $articleTotalOld})
- Unpublished: {#$articleUnpublishedOld} -- {#$articleUnpublished} ({if $articleUnpublished > $articleUnpublishedOld}+{/if}{$articleUnpublished - $articleUnpublishedOld})
- Views: {#$articleViewsOld} -- {#$articleViews} ({if $articleViews > $articleViewsOld}+{/if}{$articleViews - $articleViewsOld})
- Comments: {#$articleCommentsOld} -- {#$articleComments} ({if $articleComments > $articleCommentsOld}+{/if}{$articleComments - $articleCommentsOld})
- Reactions: {#$articleLikesOld} -- {#$articleLikes} ({if $articleLikes > $articleLikesOld}+{/if}{$articleLikes - $articleLikesOld})

Attachments
- Total: {#$attachmentOld} -- {#$attachment} ({if $attachment > $attachmentOld}+{/if}{$attachment - $attachmentOld})
- Downloads: {#$attachmentDownloadOld} -- {#$attachmentDownload} ({if $attachmentDownload > $attachmentDownloadOld}+{/if}{$attachmentDownload - $attachmentDownloadOld})
- Memory usage: {@$attachmentSizeOld|filesize} -- {@$attachmentSize|filesize} ({if $attachmentSize > $attachmentSizeOld}+{/if}{$attachmentSize - $attachmentSizeOld})

Comments
- Total: {#$commentOld} -- {#$comment} ({if $comment > $commentOld}+{/if}{$comment - $commentOld})
- Replies: {#$commentReplyOld} -- {#$commentReply} ({if $commentReply > $commentReplyOld}+{/if}{$commentReply - $commentReplyOld})

Conversations
- Total: {#$conversationOld} -- {#$conversation} ({if $conversation > $conversationOld}+{/if}{$conversation - $conversationOld})
- Messages: {#$conversationMsgOld} -- {#$conversationMsg} ({if $conversationMsg > $conversationMsgOld}+{/if}{$conversationMsg - $conversationMsgOld})

Reactions
- Reactions: {#$likesOld} -- {#$likes} ({if $likes > $likesOld}+{/if}{$likes - $likesOld})
